org.daisy.streamline.engine

Class TempFileHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.daisy.streamline.engine.TempFileHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class TempFileHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Given an initial input file and a final output file, this class can be used to limit the code needed to handle temporary files in a file to file chain. After each step (file written) the temporary files are reset by calling reset() and you are ready to use the files again. Very convenient together with optional steps. Note: TempFileHandler does not work on zero byte files. The output file must contain data when a call to swap() is made.

      • TempFileHandler

        public TempFileHandler(java.io.File input,
                       java.io.File output)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a new TempFileHandler object
        Parameters:
        input - An existing input file
        output - An output file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An IOException is thrown if the input does not exist or if the input or output is a directory or if the temporary files could not be created.

    • Method Detail

      • getInput

        public java.io.File getInput()
        Get the current input file
        Returns:
        Returns the current input file or null if TempFileHandler has been closed

      • getOutput

        public java.io.File getOutput()
        Get the current output file
        Returns:
        Returns the current output file or null if TempFileHandler has been closed

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Resets the input and output file before writing to the output again
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An IOException is thrown if TempFileHandler has been closed or if the output file is open or empty.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the temporary files and copies the result to the output file. Closing the TempFileHandler is a mandatory last step after which no other calls to the object should be made.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An IOException is thrown if the temporary files have been deleted, or are empty.
